title.narrative: 6.1 EFFECTIVE AND EFFICIENT PROGRAMME MANAGEMENT

description.narrative: ECW/MYRP - Effective and efficient Programme Management, which contributes to Access To Quality Learning Opportunities, Access To Quality Learning Opportunities (Covid), Learning, Skills, Participation And Engagement. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Communications, Advocacy And Public Engagement, Data, Research, Evaluation And Knowledge Management, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Partnerships And Engagement: Public And Private, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, Systems Strengthening To Leave No One Behind, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Crisis-affected vulnerable and marginalized girls and boys (4-17 years old) have sustained and safe access to improved quality and relevance of education in inclusive and protective environments

participating-org.narrative: UNRWA UNITED NATIONS RELIEF AND WORKS AGENCY FOR PALESTINE REFUGEES IN
United Nations Relief and Works Agency for Palestine Refugees in the Near East

sector.narrative: Provision of (formal and non-formal) multiple-levels or alternative pathways of education (including in temporary learning spaces)
System strengthening - Evidence based education sector planning
Technical assistance - Equitable access to quality education

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: ECW/MYRP - Effective and efficient Programme Management

description.narrative: ECW/MYRP programme management is operational, ensuring effective and efficient joint coordination, for planning, MEAL, risk and financial management; donor relations and reporting; communication/visibility, governance and resource mobilization. The Programme Management Unit (PMU) continued to coordinate the programme, utilizing the earlier developed systems/tools and guidance documents, spearheading joint planning, implementation, and M&E in collaboration with MoE. It successfully managed joint reprogramming for COVID-19 and partners’ emergency reprogramming requests and secured year 3 seed funds followed by a thorough reprogramming exercise led jointly with the MoE. Moreover the PMU, in cooperation with the Education Cluster, led the programming of Gaza flexible funds. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:25/01/2022

title.narrative: Developed policy guidelines on common approaches by ECW partners and MoE (66926)
Number of evidence-based ECW progress and annual reports produced(66923)
Operationalized compliance and risk management system(66922)

baseline.value: Agreements (MOUs, PCAs) put in place with all partners Initial risk analysis developed. No functional compliance or risk management systems in place.

target.value: 2021:Effective risk management system in place and utilised regularly. Risk analysis matrix updated quarterly. ECW partners in compliance with programme deliverables in additions to UNICEF HACT policies and procedures and reviews of their internal control acti

actual.value: 2021:2.1 Effective risk management system in place and utilised regularly. 2.2 Political and security risks analysis is prepared quarterly. 2.3 Risk analysis matrix updated quarterly and a monthly discussion is conducted. 2.4 ECW partners in compliance with p

title.narrative: Timely disbursements of funds and reporting of financial expenditure by partners as per signed agreements (MOUs, PCA) (66924)

baseline.value: First disbursements for year 1 transferred to 4 partners.

target.value: 2021:All disbursements, financial reports and activities completed, with funds fully (100%) utilised.

actual.value: 2021: 4.1 Min 60% total cumulative expenditure rate by the partners 4.2 Min 75% overall utlization rate 4.3 Year 3 payments processed to 4 UN partners

title.narrative: Operationalized M&E (MEAL) system.(66921)

baseline.value: No Baseline and needs assessment in place. No joint agreement among ECW partners and MoE on the needs/ importance of this assessment. No joint functional M&E plan in place. Limited M&E capacities of p

target.value: 2021:M&E Capacity development initiatives continued (4 sessions/training). Timely implementation of the M&E plan continued. Midterm evaluation completed, with management response plan developed and followed up. Seven ECW progress reports delivered. Final eva

title.narrative: Operationalized advocacy and resource mobilization plan by ECW partners and MoE beyond ECW seed funding(66925)

baseline.value: No advocacy & resource mobilisation plan in place

target.value: 2021:Advocacy & resource mobilization plan/business case updated and operationalised with support of ECW Secretariat.

actual.value: 2021:2 advocacy/communication products developed. Advocacy & resource mobilisation plan/business case developed with support of ECW Secretariat.
